content: I thought I would give you all a heads up that the Iditarod starts tomorrow (March 7, 2009). For those interested in keeping up with the grueling 1,049 mile race across Alaska, you can catch the televised broadcast at "www.ktuu.com" You can also read "Postcards of the Iditarod" stories and pictures of the race for the last 30 years at "adn.com" to celebrate the 37th and current Iditarod sled race.
reply: I thought I would give you all a heads up that the Iditarod starts tomorrow (March 7, 2009). For those interested in keeping up with the grueling 1,049 mile race across Alaska, you can catch the televised broadcast at "www.ktuu.com" You can also read "Postcards of the Iditarod" stories and pictures of the race for the last 30 years at "adn.com" to celebrate the 37th and current Iditarod sled race.
title: The Iditarod

title: The Iditarod

content: AngelHeart:--- Hiya! Great race, and the dogs LOVE their job! No whips needed. The Weather channel has a program called "When weather changed History", and they did a great story about the first serum run to Nome because of diptheria. Brave men and their dogs stepped forward ... saved many of the children in town from death! Do you get channel 10 on GCI Cable in Houston? They have been showing the dogs/mushers and course for about the last week.
reply: AngelHeart:--- Hiya! Great race, and the dogs LOVE their job! No whips needed. The Weather channel has a program called "When weather changed History", and they did a great story about the first serum run to Nome because of diptheria. They have been showing the dogs/mushers and course for about the last week.

title: The Iditarod

content: Duster... Todd Palin has raced and won before in "The Iron Dog" race. It is a race for snowmobilers ( snowmachines up here-btw), and he won it with a broken arm! The race starts in Wasilla--> Nome --> Fairbanks... about 1,971 miles. Don't forget your longjohns! The Iditarod is the dog-sled race commenarating the serum-run to Nome when the town was hit with an outbreak of diptheria. {The natives have no resistance to white-man's deseases- so the children were the first ones hit hard by the outbreak.}- { The Doctor in the town sent a telegram message to the Health department in Washington D.C. and said we need help!} No roads, harbor frozen--no ships--- airplanes couldn't make it... so a man with a dog-sled team said "I'll go". Other men/dog-teams joined along the way, like a relay race. Amazing things that some folks do!
reply: Duster... Todd Palin has raced and won before in "The Iron Dog" race. It is a race for snowmobilers ( snowmachines up here-btw), and he won it with a broken arm! The race starts in Wasilla--> Nome --> Fairbanks... about 1,971 miles. Don't forget your longjohns! The Iditarod is the dog-sled race commenarating the serum-run to Nome when the town was hit with an outbreak of diptheria. {The natives have no resistance to white-man's deseases- so the children were the first ones hit hard by the outbreak.}- { The Doctor in the town sent a telegram message to the Health department in Washington D.C. and said we need help!} No roads, harbor frozen--no ships--- airplanes couldn't make it... so a man with a dog-sled team said "I'll go". Other men/dog-teams joined along the way, like a relay race. Amazing things that some folks do!
title: The Iditarod

content: quote: Originally posted by swremwin: AngelHeart:--- Hiya! Great race, and the dogs LOVE their job! No whips needed. The Weather channel has a program called "When weather changed History", and they did a great story about the first serum run to Nome because of diptheria. Brave men and their dogs stepped forward ... saved many of the children in town from death! Do you get channel 10 on GCI Cable in Houston? They have been showing the dogs/mushers and course for about the last week. Shane, yes they do love it....Where are you here? I have been on a few sled rides and my dog has pulled a few times. They are in heaven when they are pulling a sled. They are also (IMHO)the best dogs in the world. But then again I am crazy about all dogs. I caught the end of the iditarod a few years back when I was in Nome. I have Dish Network. What network is channel 10? Is it pbs? I think I got that when I had a regular antenna.
